Class DelimitedTextCursor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.cursors.AbstractCursor<T>

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String[]>, Cursor<java.lang.String[]>

    public class DelimitedTextCursor
extends AbstractPollingCursor<java.lang.String[]>
    Cursor that reads rows of delimited text from a scanner.
    Since:
    0.10

    • Method Detail

      • poll

        public java.lang.String[] poll()
        Description copied from class: AbstractPollingCursor
        Return the next element in this Cursor, or null if there are no more elements. This must be safe to call multiple times at the end of its collection. The same element object is allowed to be reused (fast iteration), so long as AbstractPollingCursor.copy(Object) copies objects. If this method returns a fresh object every time, then AbstractPollingCursor.copy(Object) should be a no-op.
        Specified by:
        poll in class AbstractPollingCursor<java.lang.String[]>
        Returns:
        The next element, or null

      • getLineNumber

        public int getLineNumber()
        Return the number of the line returned by the last call to AbstractPollingCursor.next().
        Returns:
        The number of the last line retrieved.
